intro: Tetracera sarmentosa var. hebecarpa, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed tetracera, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
